Working with scalars

Strictly speaking correctly formed JSON text must have exactly one top-level container. (Either an Array or an Object.) Scalars, i.e. nulls, numbers, booleans and strings, are not valid JSON on their own. It can be quite convenient to pretend that such fragments are valid JSON however, and this framework lets you do so.

A scalar is also referred to as a "fragment".
